DeviceOrientationEvent.summary: The DeviceOrientationEvent interface of the {{domxref("Device Orientation Events", "", "", "nocode")}} provides web developers with information from the physical orientation of the device running the web page.

DeviceOrientationEventAbsolute.summary:
The absolute read-only property of the interface indicates whether or not the device is providing orientation data absolutely (that is,
in reference to the Earth's coordinate frame) or using some arbitrary frame determined
by the device.
See Orientation and motion data explained for details.

DeviceOrientationEventAlpha.summary:
The alpha read-only property of the interface returns the rotation of the device around the Z axis; that is, the number of degrees by
which the device is being twisted around the center of the screen.
See Orientation and motion data explained for details.

DeviceOrientationEventBeta.summary:
The beta read-only property of the interface returns the rotation of the device around the X axis; that is, the number of degrees,
ranged between -180 and 180, by which the device is tipped forward or backward.
See Orientation and motion data explained for details.

DeviceOrientationEventDeviceOrientationE.summary: The DeviceOrientationEvent() constructor creates a new object.

DeviceOrientationEventGamma.summary:
The gamma read-only property of the interface returns the rotation of the device around the Y axis; that is, the number of degrees,
ranged between -90 and 90, by which the device is tilted left
or right.
See Orientation and motion data explained for details.
